intro: Pleonotoma stichadenia, commonly known as the red-tailed leafhopper, is a small insect belonging to the family Cicadellidae. It is characterized by its slender body and distinctive red-tailed abdomen, which sets it apart from other leafhopper species. This plant-feeding insect is often found on a variety of flowering plants, where it feeds on sap. Its wings are typically green or brown, providing effective camouflage in its natural habitat. Due to its role in plant transmission of diseases, it is of interest in agricultural and ecological studies.
